channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: NHS Wales: Eluned Morgan promises to transform the service
item.description: Delivery of urgent care to be transformed during "challenging period" for the NHS, says minister.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Young farmers' club membership halves
item.description: But members are starting to return as Covid rules are relaxed, says the Wales chair.

item.title: NHS workers in Wales to get 3% pay rise
item.description: One union describes the offer as "bitterly disappointing" compared to the 12.5% it had demanded.

item.title: Dinosaurs: Fossil footprint found by four-year-old goes on show
item.description: A 200-million-year-old fossilised footprint could help scientists understand how dinosaurs walked.

item.title: Wales heatwave solves mystery of plane's fate from 1944
item.description: The mystery surrounding the 1944 US Air Force aircraft was hidden in Snowdonia's waters, until now.

item.title: Cardigan murder investigation: Tributes after man's death
item.description: A 22-year-old man is arrested on suspicion of murder after John Bell, 37, was found dead.

item.title: Heatwave: Wales' temperatures soar as holiday getaway begins
item.description: An extreme heat weather warning is in place as temperatures could hit 32C (90F) on Wednesday.

item.title: A55 Anglesey: Man crushed by lorry as he crawled from crash
item.description: Ciaran Michael Murray was seen crawling on the road before being struck by a lorry, inquest hears.

item.title: Springwatch's Iolo Williams angry as sea scooters hit birds
item.description: Springwatch presenter Iolo Williams wants users to require licences and vehicles to carry number plates.

item.title: Road safety plea for A40 ahead of summer getaways
item.description: There are calls for road improvement plans to be speeded up as people head west for their holidays.

item.title: Neo-Nazi Andrew Dymock jailed for terror and hate crimes
item.description: Andrew Dymock promoted a "distorted and wicked cause" and chose a path of "hatred and bigotry".

item.title: Covid: Young farmers' clubs lose half their flock in pandemic
item.description: Membership fell from around 4,000 to 2,000 during the pandemic, but is starting to improve.

item.title: Dinosaur footprint found by girl, 4, to go on display
item.description: The discovery by Lily may show how the extinct reptiles kept their feet on the ground.

item.title: Heatwave: Workers struggle to avoid 'unbearable' temperatures
item.description: For some workers, it is impossible to avoid the scorching temperatures during the heatwave.

item.title: Mayhill: ‘Rioters taught my son anger and hatred’
item.description: Adam Romain says his previously loving and calm son has become aggressive after witnessing a riot.

item.title: Heatwave: Stay safe in the sun, says Welsh Ambulance Service
item.description: The ambulance service urges people to take care as it faces a rising number of 999 calls.

item.title: Heatwave: Hot weather closes Pontyclun pub
item.description: Landlord Simon Cole temporarily shuts the Pipeworks Bar after the mercury hit 30.9C.

item.title: John Eustace: Queens Park Rangers assistant boss a contender for Swansea City job
item.description: Queens Park Rangers assistant manager John Eustace is a contender to be the next Swansea City boss.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Captain Alun Wyn Jones reflects on 'surreal' return
item.description: British and Irish Lions captain Alun Wyn Jones reflects on completing a remarkable recovery to lead the tourists against South Africa.

item.title: Steve Cooper: Head coach leaves Swansea City
item.description: Steve Cooper leaves his position as Swansea City's head coach after just over two years in charge.

item.title: Alun Wyn Jones to captain British and Irish Lions in first Test against South Africa
item.description: Alun Wyn Jones returns to captain the British and Irish Lions against South Africa on Saturday, in a side including three Scottish players for the first time since 1997.

item.title: Welsh Fire will 'adjust' after Jonny Bairstow's England recall, says Gary Kirsten
item.description: Welsh Fire can cope without captain Jonny Bairstow following his recall by England, says head coach Gary Kirsten.

item.title: Codiad cyflog o 3% i holl staff gwasanaeth iechyd Cymru
item.description: Undebau'n dweud fod y codiad cyflog yn rhy isel, a yn dilyn cyhoeddiad tebyg ar gyfer Lloegr.

item.title: Arestio un wedi marwolaeth dyn yng Ngheredigion
item.description: Mae teulu John Bell, 37, wedi talu teyrnged gan ddweud y bydd "colled enfawr ar ei ôl".

item.title: Pennaeth S4C yn cadarnhau ei fod yn gadael y sianel
item.description: Wrth i S4C ddweud bod mwy o bobl wedi gwylio drwy'r pandemig, mae'r prif weithredwr yn gadael.

item.title: Sut mae ymdopi mewn gwres llethol?
item.description: Rodolfo Piskorski sy'n cynnig 'chydig o gyngor ar sut i ddelio â'r haul

item.title: Steve Cooper yn gadael ei swydd fel rheolwr Abertawe
item.description: Y gred yw fod y rheolwr wedi bod yn rhwystredig nad oedd wedi gallu cryfhau'r garfan dros yr haf.
